conversion_verification.notes: Second image is a true 3D cutaway: walls have height/thickness, multiple faces are visible, and the view is isometric/elevated with the ceiling removed.

3d_conversion_fundamentals.notes: Clear 3D extrusion of walls with thickness, readable floor plane, and clean corner geometry. Cutaway is mostly clean with minor simplification in some wall/door junctions.

geometric_accuracy.notes: Overall room zoning matches: living/dining left, kitchen central, bath/WC central-lower, two bedrooms on right, detached garage on far right. Some fidelity loss: balcony/entry-edge detailing is not clearly represented and some proportions/offsets appear simplified.

interior_elements.notes: Kitchen counters/sink and bathroom fixtures are present; bedroom and living furniture are minimal/simplified (mostly sparse). Room-to-furniture assignment is generally correct but under-detailed.

visual_clarity.notes: Geometry is readable with distinct floors/walls and decent lighting. Minor ambiguity at door openings and some simplified elements; presentation is clean with no UI/text clutter in the 3D render.

detected_errors.description: Balcony/exterior threshold shown in the 2D plan is not clearly modeled/visible in the 3D cutaway, indicating partial layout omission/simplification.
Some door/opening placements and shapes appear simplified; not all openings can be confidently matched wall-by-wall to the 2D plan.
Furniture is sparse (notably living/dining and bedrooms), reducing ability to confirm room identities and scale relationships.
Rendering is clean but uses simplified geometry/materials that slightly reduce interpretability of fine architectural details.

summary: A true 3D cutaway with strong overall layout fidelity to the 2D plan, with minor omissions/simplifications (notably balcony/detailing) and sparse interior furnishing.
